place.name: TORTWORTH
place.gazetteerText: TORTWORTH, a parish in Thornbury district, Gloucester; 2 miles NNW of Charfield r. station, and 3½ W of Wotton-under-Edge. It has a post-office under Wotton-under-Edge. Acres, 1,551. Real property, £3,037. Pop., 235. Houses, 38. The manor, with T. Court, belongs to Earl Ducie. A Roman camp is in the park; and Roman relics have been found. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Gloucester and Bristol. Value, £428.* Patron, Earl Ducie The church was repaired and decorated in 1852. There are a British school, and charities £16. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
